items.title: Ronaldo wants 1k goals; open to Europe return
items.summary: Portugal captain Cristiano Ronaldo has reiterated his desire to reach 1,000 career goals before he calls time on his playing career.

items.title: Hakimi returns as Morocco seal AFCON knockouts
items.summary: Africa Cup of Nations hosts Morocco dispatched Zambia 3-0 at a fervid Prince Moulay Abdellah Stadium in Rabat on Monday to round off their Group A campaign in style and ease into the round of 16.

items.title: Wrexham into top half of Championship after win
Arteta: Arsenal 'actively looking' for January deals
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta has said the club are prepared to ease their injury problems by "actively looking" at signing new players when the transfer window reopens next month.

items.title: Hakimi neemt Marokkaanse schrik bij rentree weg
items.summary: Achraf Hakimi en Walid Regragui kijken uit naar het restant van de Afrika Cup met Marokko. De rechtsback nam de schrik die was ontstaan bij zijn rentree meteen weg, terwijl de bondscoach uitlegde hoe hij toch steeds maar weer dealt met de kritische opinie van de Marokkaanse fans.

items.title: Littler 'given a work-out' but battles past Cross
items.summary: Rob Cross made the world number one work for it, but Luke Littler stood firm to book his place in the quarter finals.

items.title: Wiegman gets honorary damehood in New Year Honours
items.summary: Ice skaters Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean become a dame and knight in the New Year Honours list, while England women's manager Sarina Wiegman is made an honorary dame.

items.title: Honours for football executives who helped save Celtic and Hearts
items.summary: Former Celtic chief executive Fergus McCann and ex-Hearts chair Ann Budge have been recognised in the New Year Honours.

items.title: Wiegman an honorary dame as Lionesses and Red Roses get honours
items.summary: England Lionesses and England Red Roses were recognised with awards in the New Year Honours list after securing more major silverware in 2025.

items.title: Serie A komt klagers tegemoet en prikt de oranje ballen lek
items.summary: De Serie A is √©√©n van de vele competities waar in de koude maanden een oranje bal wordt gebruikt, omdat die beter zichtbaar is bij winterweer. In Itali√´ klaagden kleurenblinde kijkers, en ze hebben gelijk gekregen. De oranje bal gaat verdwijnen.

items.title: Farioli sluit kalenderjaar zonder enkele competitienederlaag af met FC Porto
items.summary: FC Porto heeft 2025 met drie punten afgesloten. In eigen huis duurde het nog redelijk lang voordat de koploper afrekende met hekkensluiter AVS. Twee goals van Samu maakten het verschil.

items.title: Riedewald met een schaars maar belangrijk doelpunt
items.summary: Ook maandag wordt er weer gevoetbald in de Afrika Cup. Het Egypte van Mohamed Salah staat tegenover Angola en Marokko treft Zambia. Volg het belangrijkste voetbal van maandag in deze VI Live.

items.title: Jordan James completes double over Derby to lift sour mood at Leicester
items.summary: Doing a December double over Derby may have offered Leicester fans some festive cheer but it is unlikely to brook the festering resentment against a board whose treatment of staff over Christmas has only exacerbated ill will at the King Power Stadium. First-half goals from Bobby De Cordova-Reid and Jordan James sandwiched Rhian Brewster‚Äôs equaliser to earn manager Mart√≠ Cifuentes some respite after successive defeats. Leicester are four points off the playoff zone ahead of Thursday‚Äôs visit to Sheffield United but there are still plans for fans to boycott next Monday‚Äôs televised game with West Brom. Continue reading...

items.title: Afcon roundup: Morocco outclass Zambia to storm into last 16 while Mali squeeze through
items.summary: Morocco 3-0 Zambia | Mali 0-0 Comoros South Africa and Egypt through, Angola face nervous wait The Morocco forward Ayoub El Kaabi netted a double and the midfield maestro Brahim D√≠az added another as the Africa Cup of Nations hosts turned in a convincing performance in outclassing Zambia 3-0 on Monday to top Group A. El Kaabi powered home an early headed goal and then scored with one of his trademark bicycle kicks while D√≠az netted for the third successive game as Morocco swept their opponents aside to finish on seven points, ahead of second-placed Mali on three. Continue reading...

items.title: Aston Villa defy gravity again as winning run rolls on at Chelsea | Jonathan Wilson
items.summary: Villa keep coming from behind, keep winning by the odd goal and keep confounding the numbers. At some point it must stop ‚Äì but not yet It can‚Äôt go on. It makes no sense that it goes on. And yet it goes on. Aston Villa went into Saturday‚Äôs Premier Leage game at Chelsea having won 10 games in a row, looking to match a record set in 1897 and 1914. For an hour there seemed no chance they would achieve it, as Chelsea outplayed them, took the lead and could have had several more. But Chelsea are vulnerable with a lead, especially at home, and Villa have developed a baffling habit of winning away games having gone behind. This is an extract from Soccer with Jonathan Wilson, a weekly look from the Guardian US at the game in Europe and beyond. Subscribe for free here. Have a question for Jonathan? Email soccerwithjw@theguardian.com, and he‚Äôll answer the best in a future edition. Continue reading...

items.title: AS Roma bezorgt clublegende De Rossi terugkeer met twee gezichten
items.summary: Daniele De Rossi kan in sportief opzicht niet terugkijken op een fijne terugkeer bij zijn oude werkgever AS Roma. De Romeinen hadden aan √©√©n helft genoeg om Genoa van al hun aspiraties te beroven: 3-1.

items.title: Ipswich stun leaders Coventry to breathe life into Championship promotion race
items.summary: Ipswich narrowed the gap on the Championship‚Äôs top two with an impressive 2-0 win at Coventry, ending the leaders‚Äô unbeaten home record this season. Jack Clarke opened the scoring after 72 minutes and Wes Burns‚Äô first goal since April 2024 doubled the visitors‚Äô lead 11 minutes later. Kieran McKenna thought his side fully deserved their victory. The Ipswich manager said: ‚ÄúIn the first half there was a real confidence, a composure. We took the game on, controlled the game and had some really good chances. Continue reading...

items.title: Forest ask for VAR audio after Man City defeat
items.summary: Nottingham Forest have asked to hear the VAR audio as they consider making an official complaint following the Premier League defeat by Manchester City.
